programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Phoenix claimed victories over Utah in all three of their meetings in 2024-25, winning the most recent matchup on Jan. 11 with a 114-106 scoreline; Devin Booker posted 34 points, 5 rebounds and 4 assists for the Suns in the win at home.

programme.title: College Basketball

programme.desc: VCU (18-5, 8-2) won eight of its last nine games behind Joe Bamisile, who leads the Rams in scoring with 16.2 ppg, and won seven of the last 10 meetings; Dayton (16-7, 6-4) won four of its last five, and is 13-1 at home this season.

programme.title: College Basketball

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Saint Mary's (20-4, 10-1) had its 10-game winning streak snapped by San Francisco, 65-64, despite 20 points from Augustas Marciulionis; Oregon State (17-7, 7-4) is 14-1 at home this season behind Michael Rataj, who is third in the WCC with 17.9 ppg.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Temple (14-9, 6-4) is 4-9 away from home, but defeated the Tigers, 88-81, on Jan. 16 behind 21 points from Jamal Mashburn Jr., who leads the AAC in scoring with 22.1 ppg; No. 17 Memphis (19-4, 9-1) won six straight behind PJ Haggerty.

programme.title: ACL Kickoff Battle
programme.desc: Cornhole consists of throwing beanbags at a slanted board with a hole near the top, attempting to reach 21 points before an opponent; league consists of competitive tournaments for the professional, collegiate, and youth divisions.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Stanford claimed a 78-63 victory over Louisville in their most recent meeting in the Elite Eight on March 31, 2021, led by 21 points and 9 rebounds from Lexie Hull; Dana Evans posted 24 points and 3 assists for the Cardinals in the postseason defeat.

programme.title: UFC 312: Du Plessis vs. Strickland 2 (Prelims)
programme.desc: Scheduled UFC 312 preliminary bouts: Jack Jenkins (13-3) vs. Gabriel Santos (11-2) in a featherweight bout; Tom Nolan (8-1) vs. Viacheslav Borshchev (8-4-1) in a lightweight bout; Wang Cong (6-1) vs. Bruna Brasil (10-4-1) in a flyweight bout.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live

programme.title: SC Featured
programme.desc: Once regarded as one of the most recognizable Chiefs superfans, Xaviar "ChiefsAholic" Babudar had a much different persona underneath the wolf suit he would wear to games after news broke of his criminal bank robberies across seven states.

programme.title: NFL's Greatest Games
programme.desc: The most memorable games throughout the history of the NFL are replayed, reliving some of the marquee matchups on the biggest stages, impressive performances from the biggest names in the sport, unbelievable comebacks and playoff classics.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: A New York City DJ would change the culture of basketball in the late 1990s after putting music behind streetball highlights, creating the And1 Mixtape series to give a unique and entertaining perspective to a rarely-seen brand of basketball.

programme.desc: The most remarkable sports stories are featured, as storytellers break away from the traditional view of a sports film and showcasing stories of passion, triumph, loss and resurgence of athletes, as featured guests share their side of the story.

programme.desc: Joining the list of memorable defense lines with even more memorable nicknames in NFL history, Mark Gastineau, Joe Klecko, Marty Lyons and Abdul Salaam formed one of the most dominant defensive lines in NFL history for the New York Jets in the 1980s.

programme.desc: Growing up in Compton, Calif., Serena Williams rose to tennis stardom at an early age, winning her first Grand Slam championship at the age of 17 at the 1999 US Open over Martina Hingis and quickly jumping out of her older sister Venus' shadow.

programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.desc: USC (13-9, 5-6) is 3-2 on the road this season; No. 7 Purdue (18-5, 10-2) won three straight after a 90-81 victory over Iowa, and is 11-1 at home this season behind Trey Kaufman-Renn, who leads the Boilermakers in scoring with 18.7 ppg.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Seton Hall (6-17, 1-11) dropped eight straight since beating DePaul, 85-80, in OT on Jan. 8; Georgetown (14-9, 5-7) defeated the Pirates, 61-60, on Dec. 22 behind 19 points from Thomas Sorber after losing the previous seven meetings.

programme.title: TMZ Sports Weekend
programme.desc: The biggest sports stories and rumors of the week are covered, as the analysts break down the news surrounding each of the headlines to discuss how those involved will be impacted, along with guest interviews to get an intriguing look at sports.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: San Jose State (12-12, 5-7) won five of its last seven; Boise State (16-7, 8-4) is 10-1 at home, and is 41-4 vs. the Spartans after a 73-71 win on Dec. 28 behind 26 points from Tyson Degenhart, who is top five in Mountain West scoring at 17.7 ppg.

programme.title: Magnify
programme.desc: The disappearance of quarterback Tom Brady's jersey after leading the New England Patriots' epic comeback to beat the Atlanta Falcons in Super Bowl LI is chronicled, which includes exclusive conversations with Brady and the man who stole the jersey.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Seton Hall claimed victories over Xavier in both of their meetings from the 2023-24 season, winning the final matchup on Feb. 10 with an 86-62 scoreline; Savannah Catalon posted 21 points and 6 assists for the Pirates in the win at home.

programme.title: Saudi Pro League Soccer
programme.desc: Al-Nassr claimed a 4-1 victory over Al-Fayha in their first meeting of the season on Aug. 27, led by a brace from Anderson Talisca after 96 minutes; Cirstiano Ronaldo added a goal and an assist for Al-Nassr in the first half of the away win.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 12 St. John's (20-3, 11-1) won nine-straight games behind RJ Luis Jr., who is fourth in the Big East with 17.4 ppg; No. 19 UConn (16-6, 8-3) is 10-1 at home, and won its last four meetings with the Red Storm after taking all three last season.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Classic
programme.desc: Mike Skinner starts the 500-mile race from the pole position and is joined on the front row by Steve Grissom; Dale Jarrett, who won the 200-lap race in 1996, and Dale Earnhardt start from Row 2 with Ernie Irvan and Jeff Gordon starting from Row 3.

programme.title: Mexican Liga MX Soccer
programme.desc: Monterrey has claimed victories over Jurez in nine of their last 10 meetings since 2020, winning the most recent matchup on Sept. 18 with a 3-2 scoreline; Sergio Canales found the net with a brace for Monterrey in the win at home.

programme.title: Pro Volleyball Federation
programme.desc: Indy claimed a 3-1 victory over Orlando in their first meeting of the season on Jan. 11, behind 25 kills, 18 digs and 2 blocks from Leketor Member-Meneh; Brittany Abercrombie posted 17 kills and 9 digs for the Valkyries in the defeat.

programme.desc: Trinidad & Tobago is coming off of suffering a 2-1 defeat to Jamaica on May 5, 2024, with a goal by Salim Soanes; the British Virgin Islands claimed a 2-1 win over Saint Martin in 2022, with goals from Jaden Abrams and Johari Lacey.
